articles.title: Indian Ocean has a 'gravity hole' where sea levels are 300ft lower - experts think they know why - Daily Mail
articles.description: A 'gravity hole' south of India was formed by plumes of low-density magma that rose up from Earth's mantle, according to scientists at the Indian Institute of Science in Bengaluru.
articles.content:
Scientists have known about the existence of a 'gravity hole' in Indian Ocean for decades but have long been left puzzled as to why it exists.
